title: Learner-Centered OER Development Model (GHOSHEH) Application Process

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with introductory educational theory and digital tool utilization
context.additional_context: Strengthening pre-service teachers' competency in developing Open Educational Resources (OER) applicable to actual lesson design.

learning_goals: Learners can design OER content for social studies subjects following the four stages of the GHOSHEH model (analysis, activity implementation, evaluation, sharing)
Learners can propose collaborative solutions to problems arising during OER development through reflective practice
Learners can improve and share OER content prototypes by incorporating peer feedback

resources: OER Authoring Tools (Canva, Google Sites, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
